page.title: 12The Bryanston Arts Centre
page.content: DESCRIPTION: {The Coade Hall}at Bryanston School is the home of the {Bryanston Arts Centre,}which has rent free access & puts on drama, music, lectures & a Festival each July. Membership costs Â£2 p.a.; most live within 15 miles. To stage events costs between Â£500 & Â£1000.They are promoted in the local press and by posters in schools,libraries & shops. "Word of mouth" is also relied upon;the budget for advertising is kept to Â£1000 p.a. In the summer term 1985, the BAC put on: The Beggar's Opera by Forum Opera, using school and local performers; The Caretaker by Not the National Theatre; a Savoy Opera revue; a concert by the Gabrieli Quartet; An Evening with Jill Bennett and Edward Hardwick. The BAC is on the South West Arts circuit, which gives it the chance to put on{Arts Council}sponsored events.
